intro: Trichonema longitubum, commonly known as the long-tubed trichonema, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers produce small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Trichonema longitubum is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
